website_summaries.verdict: Good for those looking for good Internet speeds in a small package.
pros: Compatible with Comcast Xfinity, Cox, and more
Best for 300 Mbps Internet plans and above
cons: Not compatible with Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, or voice plans
Some experienced this modem heating up too much

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects every couple of hours
customer_reviews.text: Disconnects every couple of hours and gets stuck in infinite restart loop. I have to power cycle it to get it going again for another couple of hours. Comcast says everything looks fine on their end. Trying my luck with a netgear CM1000 next. Later edit: The CM1000 arrived. Over wired connection, I never got beyond 450mbps with the Arris. The CM1000 reaches 930mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Mihai

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this modem has not been great. When I got the email telling me that my provider was moving to Docsis 3.1, I was excited. I picked the Arris over the Motorola because I've had great experiences in the past with Arris modems. This one is not rock solid and requires power cycling 2 or 3 times per month. It just locks up and stops moving data. The logs are useless. My previous Arris (sb6141) never had to be touched.
customer_reviews.author: MY NAME

customer_reviews.title: Best to avoid
customer_reviews.text: I had the same problem as a number of the one star reviewers, which is that the modem reboots on it's own 2 or 3 times a day, usually at the worst time - in the middle of a movie or a phone call. Although this unit was recommended by my internet provider, it proved to be a terrible unit for me. There are better alternatives, I'd advise you to seek them out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: A must for Gigabit speed
customer_reviews.text: Been using several Arris modems for years, they are of great quality, though would be great have they are build of better plastic and have black color too. If you have Gigabit speed internet, SB8200 or and modem with DOCSIS 3.1 is a must, otherwise, your ISP may not like it and you may not get the speed worth. This modem squeeze out as much as it can from my ISP and speed is great even during high traffic hours. Make sure to check with your ISP that the modem is compatible with your Gigabit speed. If you have anything else lower, this modem is unnecessary overkill unless you want a future proof product.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Beware of customer support
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely pathetic customer support. They basically want to reprovision a malfunctioning device with my service provider so that they can run their own tests to ascertain the issue (rather than accept logs downloaded)! According to them, they have to go thru their troubleshooting process before they figure out the next step. While this is somewhat understandable, they will NOT listen to the results that are already available. So now I have to go back to my service provider, get them to unprovision my existing one, reprovision the malfunctioning device, recontact Arris, and then reverse the process with the service provider! Fun times....not!
customer_reviews.author: Vivek Sen

customer_reviews.title: Died - Cox says there is problem with the SB8200 modems
customer_reviews.text: My modem died after five months. The Cox technician said this model (or any of the white ARRIS modems) randomly drop to dial up speed, and die for no known reason. ARRIS nor Cox has been able to figure out why. Sometimes they last for a year, sometimes for just days. All of the channels showed locked on the status page, but data was not being sent or received. Swapped the modem out for an older one I replaced with this model, and it worked fine, so it was not a signal issue.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth Is Out There

customer_reviews.title: SB8200 on Comcast is great!
customer_reviews.text: Could not believe Comcast self activation worked from my computer because I tried it two other times before with other surfboards and did not work. So far everything is running great. I am on the Blast 200 plan and speeds are 240 down and 13 up. Hooked ethernet directly to computer for self activation and once it was done unplugged the modem and connected router to modem and restarted modem and everything is running great. The thing is I didn't have to call them to activate it.
customer_reviews.author: garyrh

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: Needed a Comcast approved modem that would work at 100 mb/s and higher. Was able to switch out the other modem which I also owned and get this working without a phone call to Comcast. Just know that the second ethernet port is not active, as Comcast only provides one IP unless you purchase a second IP before using.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Died within hours after connecting
customer_reviews.text: Xfinity technician tuned the frequencies, replaced wall cable connectors and splitters, made a single cable connection to get high speeds. This worked for a brief time and couldn't connect to a highspeed Linksys WiFi router and can't even connected to PCs or other devices using the onboard LAN cables on this modem. The PCs never got the IP address from this cable modem. Eventhough this was properly activated, it just worked for few hours before stopped working. All the lights everything looked good, multiple power cycles didn't work. The technician and I are very experienced professionals.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 weeks, reboots every 15 seconds
customer_reviews.text: I've used countless cable modems over the years and have never been more disappointed. Arris/Surfboard modems have been my trusted brand and the SB8200 has ruined that. The modem I purchased failed within 2 weeks, it's stuck in a constant reboot loop now and doesn't stay powered up for more than 15 seconds at a time. Tech support somehow is blaming this hardware failure on my ISP. Avoid this garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Cable One
customer_reviews.text: As much as I dislike Cable One, I do like this modem. No issues with it, we get maximum speeds (actually a little more) that we are paying for out of it (about 115 mbps down, 10 up, I think we pay for 100/5). We are hoping to get gigabit when we move in July, so I will update this when that happens to discuss performance. I think the white looks good. Have this paired up with a Google wifi puck.
customer_reviews.author: McKenna

customer_reviews.title: 2020 Review of Surfboard SB6190
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a lot of negative here for this cable modem. I’m a fairly savvy technology guy and figured that Surfboard figured out what was wrong and with Intel corrected it by now...and they have. For the money in May 2020 this is a great value for the performance. I have Cox for ISP and have the modem paired with Eero Pro routers and get every bit of performance in my 1200 sq ft home that I pay for from my ISP. I have had my set up in place for several stable months...for me it’s a thumbs up all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: MnSD

customer_reviews.title: Buggy unreliable product
customer_reviews.text: Supposedly supported by Comcast but ever since I activated it is buggy that goes off randomly and seems to overheat I've never had problems with a modem in 30 years until this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Speed with no drama
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to use with Comcast's 1Gbps cable internet offering -- it has worked flawlessly since the day I set it up. Peak speed reported by SpeedTest was 949Mbps with 800Mbps being more typical. I upgraded from an Arris SB6190 -- it also worked flawlessly. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Maiken2051

customer_reviews.title: Superb Modem... UNLESS you need MoCa support.
customer_reviews.text: Arris has always been a 'go-to' device for my modems (with Linksys for my routers). This latest version is super-fast and super easy to install. As always, Arris support is topflight. However, there was one major negative surprise for me when I attempted to connect to my various TiVo's. For some reason, Arris has discontinued MoCa support for their modems. This means that connecting to TiVo has to occur through a WiFi network, which is acceptable but less than ideal. This is the only downside of this unit, but I wanted to forewarn TiVo users (and others who use the MoCa connection).
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott Rutan

customer_reviews.title: Found out the bad reviews were correct.
customer_reviews.text: Spent the last three hours with Comcast because of this modem. Hours on the phone and three hours with a tech here at the house said my signals were good old modem works fine sb6120 I've had for years just maxing out on speed. Amazon wanted to know if I wanted a replacement and I went for the return. Don't want to deal with a tempormental modem I have a spouse for that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Edinger

customer_reviews.title: Hangs every other day, needs restart to function
customer_reviews.text: Hangs every other day, needs restart to function. Was a swap-in for older Arris modem so all the surrounding infrastructure (cables/wires/router) is proven to be working for many years. Checked signal levels with internet provided - all within range. Customer support is disappointing - could not suggest anything beyond factory reset and refused to process RMA over chat. Insisted that I'd call - being on hold for 20 minutes is exactly what I want, yup.
customer_reviews.author: random user

customer_reviews.title: Same problems as many others.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to update by SB6120. I was able to download at speeds up to 140 Mbps with my SB6120. The SB6120 is no longer supported and it was also time to update my WiFi router. It wasn't until after I purchased the SB6190 that I read about problems with the Puma 6 chipset. Installation was relatively easy. I was never able to achieve download speeds better than half of what I could achieve with the SB6120. I checked the online support information. Followed the recommendations and checked signal levels, everything looked good. Reconnected my SB6120, immediately back to 140 Mbps download speeds. Returned within less than a week. Ordered a SB6183 as a replacement. Hopefully it will work better.
customer_reviews.author: David Oosterhouse

customer_reviews.title: With Xfinity, don't even think of this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement to ARRIS cable modem SB6xxx sold in costco. Checked with Xfinity website on compatibility before buying in amazon. But, this is a really bad modem on several fronts. DocSis 3.1 doesn't work on downstream, the light never works as promised in manual. Apparently a known issue as per xfinity tech. When it loses connectivity with xfinity, on restoration of xfinity service, it cannot connect to wifi routers back and also ethernet connections doesn't work. Went thru the pain of Google Wifi/Xfinity/ARRIS support thrice in a week with this. Following any sequence of activation /reset afterwards results no internet. Returning this modem. Posting this as word of caution to others. your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: chandra

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Cox Ultimate in San Diego, CA
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Cox Ultimate internet in San Diego, CA. I'm getting 350 down and 40 up with a consistent sub 8-10ms ping via speedtest.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: ARRIS SB8200 on Spectrum/Time Warner Cable is fast and easy to connect - less than 5 minutes!!! Speed difference is incredible!
customer_reviews.text: It took less than 5 minutes from start to finish to connect to the ARRIS SURFboard SB8200 cable modem toSpectrum (Time Warner Cable). This modem is not on their approved list yet so I called them, got a technical support person on the line in about 30 seconds, and they activated it immediately. My download speeds went from 108 Mbps wire/55 Mbps Wi-Fi on an ARRIS SURFboard SBG6782AC DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem/ Wi-Fi AC17 Router to 386 Mbps wired/354 Mbps Wi-Fi. I connected the modem with an ARRIS SURFboard AC3200 Wi-Fi Router with RipCurrent and then paired the router with an ARRIS SURFboard AC1200 Wi-Fi Hotspot with RipCurrent. Unbelievable speed and coverage!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Seamless replacement for SB6183 docsis 3.0
customer_reviews.text: So I am on Cox and upgraded to a gigablast plan. Read about all of the popular Docsis 3.1 modems. All the major players have the same success stories and failure stories. Decided to go with the Arris because I have had 3 of these modems before and have no complaints or disconnects at my home. Got the modem, changed out the connections, called cox tech support, gave them the MAC address and modem was activated in Docsis 3.1 mode in a couple of seconds. Speeds close to 900 and more depending on server, uploads up to 50 on this plan on tests. After 1 week connected, no hiccups, drops, pauses, works perfectly for me so far.
customer_reviews.author: glandpuck

customer_reviews.title: A crappy modem for a crappy price.
customer_reviews.text: This modem stopped working properly about 3 months after I bought it. An outage occurred in my area, then ever since, the box kept restarting itself. Arris couldn’t tell me the issue, and didn’t help much in this case. I talked with amazon for 2+ hours trying to get this item replaced. I finally got it replaced, even though it was out of the return / replacement period. DO NOT BUY THIS MODEM. UPDATE: I received the replacement modem. It was better, but I just cancelled my cable service. The boxes the cable company gives you are crap, and that’s why I bought my own. I’m switching to a Hotspot, with unlimited data for $65 a month. Done with cable.
customer_reviews.author: UrAverageReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install - Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the Hitron modem from my cable company with this modem. I chose it because it is the latest Docsis version and I have a high enough download speed that it requires docsis 3.0. The out-of-the box experience was fine although getting the second layer of protective plastic off the front outer trim ring took some real doing. Peel it slowly... All I need to do was plug it in and call my ISP withe the MAC address. A few minutes later I was locked in and back to work. Note that if your SEND light stays GREEN (not Blue) its likely that your upload speed is still only requiring docsis 2 and nothing to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Jamazon

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem - When it works
customer_reviews.text: Initially liked this unit but for the past couple of weeks it has dropped signal multiple times per day. There is no Comcast outage and my lights look fine but my connection drops anyway. I check the Comcast outage site and it says there is an issue with my equipment and offers to restart the modem. Once I do that the connection works again but may last for hours or only a few minutes and then goes down again. Bought in mid January and it's now the end of March so past return date. I am NOT happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Stable, fast next-gen connection.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this since launch week. I have comcast Xfinity 150/20 that tests at 170/25. I have had a little over an hour of downtime since I put it in, and that was a scheduled network maintenance outage Downstream is connected 24ch plus an extra 3.1 channel via docsis3.1, upstream 4ch is still 3.0 Second Ethernet port is useless--I would love to see link aggregation If you are looking at the 6190, it has a puma chip. Google it and look at dslreports before you buy. You are much better off buying this or the 6183
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy install DOCSIS 3.1 cable modem. Works with RCN.
customer_reviews.text: Fast cable modem for high speed internet. Compliant DOCSIS 3.1 the latest standard in 2019. Easy to install, just unplug old modem and plug in new one. I did it myself, despite RCN sales saying must have a technician visit. Phoned them after I plugged it in, and RCN tech support switched over the phone. Doubled our internet download (streaming) speed at no added cost. Upload speed only slight increase (RCN restriction). Tips: ** Status lights are in blue when docsis 3.1, in green when docsis 3.0. ** Second Ethernet port is useless to most people. ** Generates heat, do not put in a closed space.
customer_reviews.author: Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot without cooling help
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my modem and purchased this. I found it runs hot so I married it to 5 inch square cooling fan. It made a significant difference. The modem performs well while cooled if I shut the fan off after four to five hours I begin to notice lag and some devices start to lose traffic, plug the fan back in and in less than an hour everything is back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No Phone Jack for Voice - beware!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this if you need voice with this modem! They should have it clearly stated in their product description (as a matter of fact, none of the Arris models selling on Amazon has phone jack). After talking to Arris which offers little help, I promptly returned. I went on to the Cablevision site and they have model recommendations and you have to buy directly from Arris. Not cheap but would rather pay this than the rental which by the way, the cable company just started this in June this year. Old account grandfathered $5/month otherwise is $10/month!! What?!?!
customer_reviews.author: tyyang3

customer_reviews.title: Comcast/Xfinity compatible but not necessarily easy
customer_reviews.text: This is on the list of COMCAST/XFINITY approved devices, however, it was quite a challenge working with Xfinity tech support to get it operational. Once Xfinity takes control, your ability to manage it directly (including passwords, etc) disappears. Doesn't run as hot as the old Surfboard 6100 that preceded it and the dropouts seen with the older unit appear to have stopped. It does have two ethernet ports, however, it really doesn't support use of both, for example, does not support VOIP on the second port.
customer_reviews.author: SteveinMA

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy the SB6190!!!! Chipset lag!!!
customer_reviews.text: *Buyer Beware* The SB6190 with the intel puma chipset is trash!!!!!! Bought this being skeptic on the latency/lag issues and wanted to see for myself. After installing and having worse speed than my SB6141 and also a tech out to my house I have returned this and purchased the SB8200. The tech tested out my setup with no exceptions and was showing excellent numbers back to their servers. Spend the extra 50-60 bucks and get the SB8200 with the DOCSIS 3.1 setting you up for future gigabit service and upgrades.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I've used Arris modems quite a bit in the past with good luck, but this turned out to be a disappointment. Even though the model Arris SB8200 is listed as supported for DOCSIS 3.1 by my ISP, and my levels were spot on, it would only connect at DOCSIS 3.0 (only green lights, no blue). I could activate it with my ISP just fine but only connect at 3.0. Because of that the speeds at DOCSIS 3.0 were slow and actually slower even than the modem it was going to replace. Went back to my old modem which is working fine and returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Horribly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this modem, but after several hours of trying to get it installed, I gave up. After connecting to my cable provider, it would not automatically provision. Called Comcast and, although it showed on their system, they had problems provisioning it manually. Finally got it connected, but signal kept dropping off. Opened a chat session with Arris, and diagnostics showed all was good, but it would not stay connected. I finally gave up after 4 hours and plugged in my old modem, which connected like a charm. I'm returning the SB8200, and will look at another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kaptain Kremen

customer_reviews.title: Works with RCN Boston
customer_reviews.text: Set up - Instead of calling, use Twitter based support to contact RCN. Tell them you have a new cable modem. They'll ask you the MAC address of the cable modem. Provide them the MAC address on the cable mode. Once they provision it, you should be all set. It's nearly a nightmare to do this over the phone. I was on the phone with RCN support multiple times and they couldn't even find my account... I was on hold for an hour and end up not getting anywhere. Once the MAC address provisioned, it works as it should. Be sure to have a good firewall behind the cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: ComputerGeek

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem for Upcoming 1.0 gb Service
customer_reviews.text: As part of my preparation for the 1gb internet service soon to come, I went ahead and purchased this modem. Even though the service is yet to be available, the combination of this modem and my Netgear router has already improved our home's network and Wi-Fi signal greatly! Another good thing about this modem, is that it's mountable on a wall. This allowed me to install it inside the already-crowded network panel. It's been over a month and it's still working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kahuna AZ

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent internet speed - defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an older model when I upgraded my internet service to a high speed of 400 Mbps. After the upgrade, my normally stable internet speeds became very inconsistent. I would test connected directly to the modem and I would see 400 and then test again and see below 10 at times. It was never the same and the swing in speeds were extreme. After two days of support with my provider and lots of reboots, resets, reprovisioning, I just gave up. I went to a local store and purchased another unit (same model). After working with my provider, I have consistent high speeds now.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Tried out this modem for about 6 months. Was good at first but eventually it would lose connection and disconnect me. I decided to upgrade to a Motorola 7316. Just started using it today so we'll see how it goes. Thought someone was hijacking my connection but after reading other reviews sounds like this is common with this model. It (Motorola) has a higher capacity and it shouldn't lose connection like the surfboard which looks pretty dated when you put them side by side.
customer_reviews.author: jambandfreak

customer_reviews.title: Old model modem, defective....would recommend buying newer version
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend. Modem would not connect to Comcast service. Called Comcast and they could not get it to connect after relaying all the info on the modem to them to setup. Then I called Arris and they tried as well and confirmed that the modem must be defective and to return. Comcast also said this modem would no longer be compatible with their system in the near future, contrary to product description. I did however purchase a newer Arris model because their customer service was helplful.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Arris cable modem 1 year old failed. Poor product life for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem in February 2018. It ran pretty well in the intervening period except for a few required resets. Two weeks ago it failed. I had to pay cox to come out to troubleshoot since I wasn’t home at the time. They installed one of their combo modem routers to get me service until I could replace it. It turns out this product has 23% lousy reviews including frequent resets and premature failures. Also their customer service got very bad ratings so I didn’t even try to contact them. This will be my very last arris product. I bought a Netgear CM1000 to replace it. Don’t waste your money with Arris.
customer_reviews.author: Number Three

customer_reviews.title: Good modem
customer_reviews.text: The modem is working as expected. The only problem that I had is that multiple times a day the modem lost connection and then it restarted. I read another review that had the same problem and it turns out it was a problem with the line itself, so I went and connected the coaxial cable to my surge protector and I haven't lost connection since then.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: The SB6190 is no good
customer_reviews.text: The SB6190 is no good. Please note that Amazon is grouping reviews for multiple modems on here; I doubt anyone is giving this one 4+ stars. I had an SB6141 that I never had to reset in five years of ownership (unfortunately wouldn’t power on after relocating). Was inclined to try a faster modem as my connection was upgraded. This SB6190 might give me 450mbps down, or it might only give 6mbps down. Latency is horrible, jitter is horrible. Returning it and installing the SB6183 with fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Fast product
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of renting a modem fro my cable provider and decided to take my money and buy my own. This is an easy to setup and it's faster then providers modem. My speeds are way faster now. Just plug it in, let in sync up, call your provider to give the the numbers and they will activate it on your acct. That easy. Paired it with a wifi router and now i get whole house wifi, and couldn't be happier. Great product that was cheaper than buying at local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: DOA Possibly a previous customer return that was put back into inventory
customer_reviews.text: Spent 3hrs on the phone with Comcast trying to trouble shoot the modem only to figure out it was defective. The Modem kept on Re-Booting every 5 seconds. The package seem new but was missing the Ethernet cable? When I reordered a replacement the 2nd unit was fully sealed and came with the Ethernet Cable. So the first unit was possibly a customer return that was reintroduced back into inventory. Replacement unit works like it should, Still disappointed in the time wasted trying to troubleshoot a used unit that was more than likely returned by a previous customer.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a difference!
customer_reviews.text: We have an older model, Arris modem (an SB6141), and it's worked flawlessly for the last 5-6(?) years, but it's incompatible with the faster broadband service we have so we upgraded to this modem. It was easy to install: just connect it and power it up. The difference in page drawing speed was night and day; they come up very quickly now. Yay! The only negatives (as such) we had with the new modem was contacting Support for information on how to register it for warranty--the agent was clueless and annoyingly terse.
customer_reviews.author: A 21st Century Man

customer_reviews.title: Product looks good, but still registered to someone else
customer_reviews.text: Bought product from Amazon Warehouse. I knew it was used. Product is physically in excellent condition. Unfortunately, because it’s already (and still) associated to another Comcast customer, Comcast could not connect this to my account without a lengthy investigation process. This should have been unassimilated with the previous owner prior to it being listed for sale. It caused me a lot of calls to Comcast (which is always fun) to only find out that I can’t use this device. At least not for a while.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: problems with packet loss after several hours running
customer_reviews.text: Modem seemed to work fine when installed, but I noticed the development of packet loss (as determined by speedtest) after running for many hours. I could reset back to normal by disconnecting router (Eero Pro) and reestablishing connection, but it would again only last for several hours. I spent a huge amount of time trying to determine whether due to Eero pro (brand new), but then read on many less obvious web sites that the Puma 6 chipset in this modem is considered unreliable. Therefore I swapped out this modem for the Arris SB8200 - after that the problem was gone. My ping improved a bit too. Amazon was willing to refund this after return.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I would say for my first 3.1 modem the improvement over my Motorola 3.0 modem was not worth the investment. The main issue I have with this modem is that my internet connection is now much more spotty once i started using this modem. On my old 3.0 it was always a solid fast connection. I would recommend alternative brands opposed to this one especially the one available through Costco.
customer_reviews.author: Zeek

customer_reviews.title: Good modem. Connects at great speeds.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast modem. It does not have WiFi capabilities so I'm not sure why that is a option to rate. It was a weird setup as only one of the ports can be used per service provider. So make sure you get a router with plenty of Ethernet ports or a network switch. Connect this directly to the router not through any switches first as the router needs the IP directly from the modem and it cannot be split. I have 600mbps from Xfinity and after having them activate the modem on their side I receive 600mbps+ when connected via Ethernet. Having a knowledge of networking really helps with the setup.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Evans

customer_reviews.title: Any modem featuring the Puma 6 chipset is an absolute "do not buy".
customer_reviews.text: Everything seemed OK at first, but then I started to notice some strange lags and disconnections. I looked into the modem and the technology behind it, the "Puma 6" chipset. I don't care about the people apologizing for it, and saying it's not that bad. It is absolutely as bad as implied. I replaced it after about 2 weeks with a Netgear modem and the difference in performance is more than noticeable. This really is sort of a garbage modem, with a garbage chipset that should never have been released. Buy literally anything that doesn't have the Puma 6 chipset. It cannot be patched or fixed. It does not perform well, and it is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: David Moorhead

customer_reviews.title: May not work on Spectrum - buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Although Spectrum activated the modem for me without question and it appeared to work just fine, I started quickly having network issues including dropouts lasting an hour or more at a time. The symptoms all pointed to a problem with my cable drop. After Spectrum sent someone on site to investigate I was informed that they no longer recommend Arris modems due to software issues with their provisioning which can cause the issues I encountered. Swapped it out with their own equipment and all of my connectivity issues went away.
customer_reviews.author: Chris HorryTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cable internet
customer_reviews.text: This Arris Surfboard 3.0 is the exact same modem my cable company rents to me for $10 a month. It works just as well and in 7 months will have paid for itself. The rental was white but I definitely like the black as it blends better with my home office. It was easy to set up, just had to call the cable company and they had to verify the number on the bottom, and literally plug in all the connections. What else is there to say? It works and now I've got internet without the extra fees!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa G

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play...
customer_reviews.text: I mean, it's a docsis 3.1 modem. Plug and play, call Xfinity, boom your're interwebz'd. I gave this 4 stars because it didn't come with an ethernet cable. I mean, come on Arris, when you buy a router, modem, computer, etc most of them come with the basics, which an ethernet cable is a basic. Why would you not include that?
customer_reviews.author: autumn

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works, Intel Puma 6 Defect
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this is still #4 on best sellers list. My modem has been working like a champ for months and then for the past 2-3 weeks its been such a headache. Modem would randomly lose connection completely, leds would be all light up like the connection is good but no webpages would load. I've then done my research about this modem and the Intel Puma 6 chip that is being used has a known defect, can't believe this is still being sold on amazon or any website at this point.
customer_reviews.author: ASU_Go_Devils

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Service is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Arris approved my replacement, but want me to pay $16 for them provide 'advance replacement service'. Meaning, there's a non-refundable fee for them to replace the device unless I want to wait multiple weeks to first ship the broken one to them, then wait for the replacement. While Arris gets good ratings for their product performance (and that is why I purchased it initially), I cannot recommend due to their warranty replacement policy. If you have any issue with your modem, your choices are to have no internet for weeks, or to pay for 'advance' service. Not much of an option...only real choice is to buy Motorola or other brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: bryce

customer_reviews.title: Check you device compatibility!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in February and it seemed to work well until we added an eero router to support our home sound system. After having serious data drop and streaming issues I was finally able to determine that it is incompatible with our eero and I need to replace it with a different modem. I’m more than a month past return date so unless they will make an exception it’s On me. Evidently our ISP doesn't push the fix Arris provided so it’s not manufacturers fault and of course we all know the ISPs do what they please and charge what they like
customer_reviews.author: PelicanPower

customer_reviews.title: DO not buy. The negative reviews are correct.
customer_reviews.text: My bad. I did not believe the negative reviews which say this thing hangs all the time. I wanted to take a chance, also because my previous ARRIS worked flawlessly for several years. But this thing, just like other reviews say, hangs/restarts every a couple of hours. Unfortunately I threw away the box. Now I need to see if Amazon let me to return it. Even I can return, I have to call my ISP twice to switch back the older one, and then when I buy another brand (current one won't handle the high internet speed).
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wow!100 times better than my Comcast Modem. Also saved money by returning my Modem back to Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: This modem works excellent and easy to install. It does not have a port for telephone. This works so much better than the one I received from Xfinity and pods without the monthly cost. Worth while to switcht to this system. Xfinity has terrible customer service as well. Xfinity is junk compared to this
customer_reviews.author: Property4sail

customer_reviews.title: SB6141 not compatible with Comcast/Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: I had an SB6141 that was locking up frequently, starting with once a month to a few times per day near the end. It seemed to happen on small but sustained upload events, like syncing Google photos from my phone. I figured my modem was the problem after troubleshooting splitter and cable issues. I installed this new one, and activated, and had the same issues. Turns out it's not supported by Comcast anymore. I got a Netgear CM600 and have had no issues so far, and I'm 4 days in with no reboots needed. The page is outdated saying it works with Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: phishook

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people have lambasted this modem as having a poor chipset that causes major lag spikes. I have not incurred any issues with these, and really have only reset it maybe 3-4 times in the year I have been using it. I do a lot of online gaming, as well as working through a remote desktop home since COVID started, and I have not had any issues with lag, connection, ping, etc. FYI, I'm using on Xfinity 100mb/s plan with my own separate wifi/router.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Buy now Don't think twice
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the 600mps one omg it is night and day. When I do a speed test it pegs right at 490 within a second vs it would slowly get there In 10 seconds. They build these things to make us spend more $$ plus I just upgraded modem to a ASUS 11000. From. NETGEAR 9000. I KNOW HAVE NO LAG. AND NO SLOW DAYS. I was rebooting internet daily. Have not since I purchaded combo. I wish Spectrum had the 1g where I live but they don't only up to 500.
customer_reviews.author: Lee OnAWhim

customer_reviews.title: Installation was mostly easy
customer_reviews.text: This modem installed easily, as far as hooking it up and turning it on. However, my broadband supplier (Cox) didn't recognize the new box. Had to call them to get it recognized and accepted. Didn't cost anything except some time. Some reviewers suggested having two internet addresses assigned by the ISP. My provider usually charges extra for that feature. In any case it was unnecessary in my case. Your mileage, of course, may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence WalshTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Arrived DOA :-( - Thanks Amazon Warehouse!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the straw that broke the camel's back for me with respect to buying items via Amazon Warehouse. First, item was delayed, Amazon was nice enough to provide me a credit, but then when I go to hook up the modem the green power light comes on but...nothing. My ISP (Cox) can't "see" the modem on their end. I have come to the conclusion that the "quality sticker" they put on Amazon Warehouse items is there basically to hold the damaged box together. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: El_roy

customer_reviews.title: Better than your ISP provided modem
customer_reviews.text: TW Spectrum's provided hardware has the same amount of channels but they do not bond all of them. I believe they only bonded to 8-16 channels down. I purchased this one with hopes of better performance and it definitely delivered. Once activated, I check the bonded channels and all 32 channels down were bonded, and still are. But only 4 of the 8 channels up are bonded which is fine for my needs. I would definitely recommend this modem or the next model up if you think your ISP will ever provide that much bw.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy "Renewed" items from Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Amazon as a "renewed" item. Found out the AC adapter in the box isn't the correct one (it actually says Netgear on it) so dont believe anything is renewed or even tested. Obviously someone switched out the power supply and sent it back. Amazon didn't even check it because the plug on the wrong adapter doesn't even fit! Lucky I had another Aris modem and used that adapter. Too soon to tell how well it works. Only had it a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Magoo356

customer_reviews.title: Misleading packaging/page:  theoretical max download speed of 2Gbps, not 10Gbps.
customer_reviews.text: The dual gigabit ethernet links and no wifi limit this device to a theoretical maximum of 2Gbps, not the "10+ Gbps" printed in big bold letters in the packaging / selectable in the amazon product page. The fine print is meant to point out things like "speeds depend on your ISP, plan, wiring, and other equipment", not "the number on the front of the package can't possibly be served by *this* equipment". Also had to spend an hour on the phone with Comcast as confused techs troubleshooted and escalated until they managed to fix the modem configuration / firmware / ??? on their end, when the self service portal errored out repeatedly with my modem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 days in... still FIVE STARS!
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed with this cable modem. I replaced my perfectly functioning Arris because it had topped out on speed with my current plan with Spectrum. I simply wanted faster internet, and found this through Amazon Warehouse for a much discounted price. Works flawlessly. I went from a maximum speed of 100+mbps... to over 400+mbps (yes I am paying for more). Happy to see that speed increase instantly as soon as I turned everything on. Maybe this cable modem will give me issues down the long and winding road (knock on wood) and maybe it won't. In the meantime... a very solid FIVE STAR amazon item.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A. Hofstetter

customer_reviews.title: sb6183 Delivered better perfomance
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade my modem from the sb6183. I was getting avg 452 Mbps. My service is for 600Mbps. That is close to max output for sb6183. I figured this modem would give same performance and not work as hard. Setup was easy, up and running in 10mins . While speed tests were 552 Mbps, watching Apple tv or Disney plus, the stream would pixelate and lag. Restarted twice and waited a couple of days. Same issue. The sb6183 ran everything smoother. I'm debating on returning it and going back to my sb6183 or getting the motorola mb8600.
customer_reviews.author: Kafr Malik

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Never get disconnected
customer_reviews.text: I have this Modem for a while now. I read up on all the comments before i bought this product. Especially the negative ones but i have not been disconnected to the net even once. Well with the exception of cox reseting its connection once evry 2 weeks. Its worth the Buy. Make sure to buy the insurance just in case ;). The difference of performance between this product and the cable modem rental was remarkable. This product by far is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable! Not the easiest setup
customer_reviews.text: Originally did not intend to buy this modem until COVID hit and we realized our existing model was too slow when our whole family and various devices are connected. We decided to go with Motorola because our old surfboard was reliable, quick, and solid bang for the buck. Sure there are faster modems out there, but we wanted the reliability and support that Motorola offers. We would definitely recommend this product and would buy it again. Pros: -Fast. -Reliable -Solid support system Cons: -Upload speed isn't as fast as the competitors -Setup was also not very easy and required a bunch of tinkering between the router and our internet provider.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Defective!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on March 23rd and started to be defective by March 28th. It won't go above 20 mbps and I have tried multiple resets and checked cords. I even contacted Comcast and they couldn't find any other problem besides a bad modem. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: MECHSBOX

customer_reviews.title: greast higher speed (over 1 gig) modem
customer_reviews.text: this is a modem only. it does not proved any router functions and is priced accordingly. compatible with xfinity and others. good customer service. be advised that in order to use the 2nd lan port at the same time, you need to get a second IP address from your service provider. that shouldn't prevent you from considering this unit. it has been dependable and was very easy to get up and running without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Overheard after a few months usage.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 4 months. Overheats now after a few hours of use. Near two hundred dollar modem already having this type of issue? Not a good look. Guess I’ll test how good their customer service is and may adjust rating based on that at a later time.
customer_reviews.author: Brock

customer_reviews.title: Works well for gigabit speed
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded my home wifi speed, and my modem wasn't able to handle the download speeds I was paying for. Upgrading to this modem now allows me to get the full speed I pay for from Comcast. Please note that this will not automatically make your internet "faster". This is only able to connect that the speeds your ISP provides, but this makes sure you're not getting limited on your connection if you have a gigabit plan.
customer_reviews.author: Nick R.

customer_reviews.title: Has been nothing but problems since the beginning
customer_reviews.text: The speed is great but I have to reset it monthly. Today I had to hard reset due to the Port 1 ethernet PHY failing with lots of errors... Support didn't care and said as long as it comes back to functional that's "acceptable" functionality... Motorola used to be the best with the surfboard series, I guess this is what happens when you offshore technology. Arris's customer support was horrible. They're given scripts to lie to the customers and it was really a disgusting experience. 3 separate 45 minute calls and I was able to get a return authorized but it was really painful. I would NOT recommend EVER buying this modem or any product from Arris.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Tried everything to make it work.
customer_reviews.text: Cons: -Intermittent connection at best. Had to reset up to 4 times daily. -No power button. You have to unplug to reset. (In my case, I had to move a large media console each time.) -Mediocre customer service. Bought this modem to replace an aging Surfboard modem from 10 years ago. I never got anything but intermittent connectivity from this modem. My ISP (Spectrum) refuses to troubleshoot because it's not their branded equipment. Arris Tech Support blamed a non-standard power signal from the ISP for the modem not working. Spectrum blamed the modem for being faulty. We replaced this modem with a Motorola product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Africa

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: One of the worse tech purchases I've ever bought. This modem is so unreliable. It randomly disconnects, I spent weeks trouble shooting and working with their awful tech support. After I was eventually told they can't help me, the return window expired. Awful modem, reasonably effective paper weight
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Modem does not work with Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: This modem absolutely will not work correctly with my Xfinity cable internet. I tried repeatedly to set up the first modem I received, but it could not be activated by me or Xfinity tech support. I ordered a replacement and that modem was able to be set up, but the internet would connect and disconnect constantly. I received a third unit that also had the same issue. My old Arris modem worked perfectly for years. I had to get a 2018 Linksys modem to use and it works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a SB6121 that only gave me 140mbit, and now I get 209mbit on this SB6183 (xfinity said my package is 175mbps so I got a bonus) Also I Bought the SB6183 used for $23 so I saved a bunch of money over the new price, if you buy used be sure to login to 192.168.100.1 and do a factory reset on it before configuring it to your ISP Another Thing to keep in mind is be sure to use a 2500mhz signal booster between the wall and the modem, it will help the connection stay way more stable. I use this GE one linked here
customer_reviews.author: Nite

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My setup is TP-Link TL-ER5120 wired router with an Asus RT-N66u WI-FI router. Had my own Arris SB6121 using Comcast Internet. My SB6121 worked fine for 4 years going from 50 to 100mbps Comcast speeds during that time. Comcast bumped up my speed recently to 250mbps so I bought the Arris SB6183. Ookla speed test shows me at 298mbps up and 12mbps down. So far so good and the SB6183 runs cool. I was unable to hook this up via Comcast online, though a 10 minute call to them took care of that.
customer_reviews.author: Siffert

customer_reviews.title: Could not use with Xfinity because modem was already registered to another customer
customer_reviews.text: This modem was unusable. Xfinity would not activate this refurb modem on my account because it was already registered to another active subscriber. I'm guessing the previous owner returned the modem to the store after activating it on their Xfinity service. Xfinity support would not do anything and said I need to contact the previous owner (which is impossible since I bought from Amazon and they did not know who the previous customer was either).
customer_reviews.author: Neildo

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I was Leary after seeing reviews all over the board, but we had the previous version of this modem for 6 years and it worked great so I figured it would be worth trying the docsis 3.1 version. It’s been running for about 2 months now straight, not a single issue, much faster than the previous model.
customer_reviews.author: Boof

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Big difference. I’m very surprised at the difference in speeds yet didn’t change my plan. Getting ready to though. No packet loss, no issues and easy setup. I’m a huge Arris fan. Love their products. Their Docsis 3 was fine but I’m ready for gig service now. There is a new patch and firmware. Have had it running about 2 months with 0 issues, no resets and everything working smoothly so far. Will update at 6 months. Many months: no problems whatsoever. Using with linksys AC2200 wireless mesh 3 node solution. Still running strong.
customer_reviews.author: Rockies

customer_reviews.title: Increased my download speed by over 70 Mbps!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier model (sb6141) which was great! Very easy to install as long as you follow the instructions. Anyway, the older model allowed up to 343 Mbps download speed, but since my maximum internet download speed was limited to 200, all I could ever teach was around 250 max with Comcast’s speed burst. Once I installed this new modem, my download speed reached an incredible 321 Mbps!!! I’m not understanding how it’s doing it but I’m not complaining. Wow, just wow! Glad I swapped it out!
customer_reviews.author: BadAndy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t compatible with Xfinity!!!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for a schedule Xfinity tech to install my internet. He check the serial number found that doesn’t compatible with their network. Whattttttt! He told me I am not the only 1 that has this issue. Many people got this from amazon doesn’t work. Not all of them doesn’t work, just because I am so unlucky. He told me just go to bestbuy get one. So I have to rent Xfinity modern and brought another modern to install later. What a waste of time! So Buyer beware if you buy this there is a chance that this doesn’t compatible with Xfinity.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Feng

customer_reviews.title: Maybe this one will last more than a year?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the last one I had that died in about a year. I would have bought something different, but all this Chinese crap is pretty much the same. It's gotten to the point where you can't find good products even if you are willing to pay a small fortune for them. It's all made in china now. I bought a USB powered fan (plugged into the USB slot on my router) that I have up against it to keep it cool. These things get pretty hot and maybe that is what causes them to fail so quickly?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Xfinity and fewer dropouts
customer_reviews.text: Product worked for Xfinity even though it took it a while to set up. Got hung up on the Xfinity activation screen for half an hour and I just rebooted and then it miraculously worked. Unfortunately not seeing much faster speed but on analysis it has 32 bonded download channels which is way more than my 8 channel surfboard. hopefully that'll help with stability and consistent speed.
customer_reviews.author: outwest

customer_reviews.title: returned but no refund
customer_reviews.text: this is not so much the sellers fault as it is the morons at comcast/Xfinity. I bought this to save money on the monthly fee for modem rental, because they told me my previous ARRIS would not optimize my internet speed. I have since returned the item, but have not received a refund and am still paying monthly fees to Xfinity because I'm cautious about buying another modem, and they're too difficult to talk to on phone, online, and when an outsourced tech comes here, they tell me this was wrong in the first place and I never should have signed up with comcast.
customer_reviews.author: NYCHRIS

customer_reviews.title: used and lower end modem
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this model so I can get rid of the rental modem from xfinity. Received product, was excited to unbox and connect. Opened box and saw that item had dust where you connect the cable and ethernet. Looked at the front to check the model and found out that I received an old and used item and a lower end model. You guessed it, returning this item and will just continue to rent modem.
customer_reviews.author: H L

customer_reviews.title: What is the point?
customer_reviews.text: Before I got this modem, I had an old cheap one with a max speed of 150 Mbps and I was consistently getting speeds of ~120-130 Mbps. But, I was paying for ~200 Mbps from my ISP and so I decided to get a modem that could handle more than 150 to hopefully maximize my speed. So I got this one and now I'm consistently getting ~8-10. That's less than 10% of what I was getting from an old cheap one! I'm not an IT guy or a mathematician, but I'm pretty sure this new one is worse than my old one. If anyone can explain why, I'd love to hear it...
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Charter Cable Company currently cannot activate this model
customer_reviews.text: Charter is unable to activate this model for some reason. Their Tech folks tried for over an hour to activate, but were unsuccessful. They noted that although this model is on there list of compatible modems, other "trouble tickets" were seen in their computer system, and they are working to resolve the issue. They could not give me any estimate on when or if they will overcome the issue, so I was forced to return this item. For the record, the modem fired up perfectly and immediately went online and onto the internet, but Charter immediately "sees" the new modem and takes you directly to their website for activation, and there is no way to get around them.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Alvey

customer_reviews.title: Works with Cox, but they will try to disuade you
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is a DOCSIS 3.0 modem Cox tried very hard to get me to ditch it and rent their own. Their techs will try and mislead you and call this modem ancient but it works very well if you aren't on a fiber optic plan. Just a warning to future Cox customers, double check their website first and make sure they still have it listed as supported or their techs may refuse to even activate it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Gravy Robber

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy for Xfinity. Keeps dropping internet connection few times a day. Tech support did not stay on 3 way call made to Xfinity. Xfinity came and checked and changed a splitter and boosted upstream signal to 43 dBmv from.45 dBmv and still did not help the intermittent loss and recovery of interest. Retuning the unit and trying Netgear. Let us hope that works.
customer_reviews.author: SgK

customer_reviews.title: RCN compatible and works just as it should.
customer_reviews.text: It does what is supposed to do. I have RCN. It is compatible. I pay for 250 megabits and peer test at 350 plus. It could simply that RCN is sloppy about speed caps. One odd thing. The downstream icon is blue meaning it’s on Docsis 3.1 while the upstream is green meaning Docsis 3.0. This oddness is just that as I’m getting the speed I pay for. The model is hidden away and forgotten about. Exactly as it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew RM

customer_reviews.title: All kinds of issues. I think not compatible with ...
customer_reviews.text: All kinds of issues. I think not compatible with Comcast Xfinity Service cuz Comcast Xfinity only allows three channels upload. Arris is saying that you need at least 8 channels upload otherwise it's going to be bugging you have issues . Comcast says it's not their problem they only allow three. And when this gets buggy and shuts down it shuts down my whole mesh Wi-Fi network not worth it. As soon as another internet service provider moves in my area I never going to have Comcast again until then I'm stuck with them as far as arris not really sure. Everyone seems to blame each other. All I know is it's not working as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Newell

customer_reviews.title: Mediacom helped me install in.
customer_reviews.text: We moved to a new house and had Mediacom come out and install their all-in-one modem/wireless router. A few days later I sent it back and replaced it with this modem and a Synology RT2600c wireless router. I was struggling with the install but Mediacom phone support used the mac address from the back of this ARRIS unit and I was running in a few minutes. The combination of this modem and the Synology takes a few minutes to get all negotiated, but if you're patient the two will figure it out. And when I was done I had much better Wifi range than I had with the Mediacom all-in-one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sluka

customer_reviews.title: Trust the negative reviews: this modem will lose connection every hour
customer_reviews.text: I figured the negative reviews claiming the modem loses connection every hour were a thing of the past; unfortunately, the unit I bought very much suffered from this problem. There is something about Docsis 3+ modems which these manufacturers can't get right and its on full display with this modem: every hour, the modem would lose connection without fail. Worse, I noticed my latencies were twice as high with 1000ms being average for pages that previously would access in under 10. Reverting back to my old motorola surfboard which was not docsis 3.0 compliant and page access times went back to normal. What the hell? Save your time on this brand, it's garbage.
customer_reviews.author: AKallos

customer_reviews.title: Gigabit Speed - Pricey but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what what you pay for. Its pricey but I'll never pay rental fees for a cox communication modem/router. Surfboard is plug and go (as long as your provider has all the information). We had a problem connecting but it was all COX and had nothing to do with the modem. Its steady providing gigibit speed (980mpbs+). If you can find this used for less, Id get it.
customer_reviews.author: Lou T.

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with Xfinity GIG speed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when upgraded to gig speed, first modem wasn't getting anywhere near gig speed. Had tech come out, noticed bonded unknown downstream channel 159 with millions of errors. Tech said it was the modem. Borrowed a XFINITY modem which ran perfectly until my new ARRIS modem arrived. Now on modem number 2. Same exact issues, got ARRIS tech support on the phone while xfinity tech was over. Xfinity said it ARRIS, ARRIS said it was xfinity. Xfinity tech told me netgear wasn't experiencing the issues. Will be returning and ordering a netgear modem. Such a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Spent 3 hours with Comcast Support (3 people) and they couldn't get the Speed Test provisioned to be at 150Mbps, it was only getting .5Mbps. slower then a snail. The modem setup was easy initially, but the device did not functions properly, it's Ethernet ports were DOA. Had to go back to my SB6121 and got the 150Mbps speed back. Spent almost $200 dollars and it didn't deliver, sad to say the least. At least returning it with Amazon was very easy and painless...so far. Haven't received my money yet because I just setup the return, so I'll post more if thing turn side ways.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: NO WIFI READ THE DESCRIPTION
customer_reviews.text: Hey you, wake up! This modem doesn't have wifi, uh oh! What kind of modem sold in 2019 doesn't have wifi OR more than ONE ethernet port? This is your grandpa's modem. Get a modem with wifi and router switching for the same price. Amazon recommended this one to me, what a waste. Once you get it installed, you will not want to go through the hassle of buying a new one and getting on the phone with your ISP to set it up... It does what it is supposed to do just fine, but poor amount of features for the price! It's not a bargain at all.
customer_reviews.author: Your Avg. Consumer
